page.title: 10The Post Office
page.content: The{Post Office}was built in 1938. It is red brick with tiled roof and windows divided into small square panes. The{Telephone Exchange}at the back of the Post Office was built in 1952. The{General Post Office}is on the ground floor. Behind it is the{Sorting {Office}.40 postmen and postwomen work in the sorting office. They start work at 5.00 am. They sort the letters into their own delivery areas before going out on their delivery rounds. In the{ {Sorting Office}are rows of pigeon holes into which the letters are sorted. Each pigeon hole represents a road in{Billericay}.{1st Class Mail}is delivered, then{2nd Class Mail}is sorted and delivered. The sorting office is cleared twice in every day.
